title: Add Panel convenience constructors
description:
Add semantic Panel constructors for common use cases.

## New Methods
- `.info(content)` - Blue border, 'Info' title
- `.warning(content)` - Yellow border, 'Warning' title  
- `.err(content)` - Red border, 'Error' title
- `.success(content)` - Green border, 'Success' title

## Example Usage
```zig
const panel = Panel.info("Server started on port 8080");
const warning = Panel.warning("Config file not found, using defaults");
const error_panel = Panel.err("Connection failed");
const success = Panel.success("Build completed successfully");
```

## Implementation Notes
- Each constructor should set appropriate border color
- Each should have a sensible default title
- Consider whether to use different box styles (e.g., rounded for info, heavy for error)
- Keep API consistent with existing Panel.fromText() pattern

title: Document renderable protocol
description:
Document the render protocol for creating custom renderables.

## Documentation Goals
- Explain the render(width, allocator) ![]Segment protocol
- Show how all built-in renderables implement this interface
- Provide template for creating custom renderables

## Example Counter Implementation
Document a complete example showing a custom renderable struct with a render method that:
- Takes width and allocator parameters
- Returns a slice of Segments
- Properly handles memory allocation

## Documentation Location
- Add to README or create dedicated docs/CUSTOM_RENDERABLES.md
- Include in-code doc comments on Segment type
- Consider adding a renderables/example.zig for reference

## Key Points to Cover
1. Memory ownership (caller owns returned slice)
2. Width parameter semantics
3. Style propagation
4. Segment structure and meaning
5. Error handling expectations

title: Add semantic error types
description:
Create src/errors.zig with structured error types for better error handling.

## Error Types to Create

### MarkupError
- UnmatchedTag - Opening tag without closing tag (or vice versa)
- InvalidColorName - Named color not recognized
- InvalidStyleAttribute - Style attribute not recognized
- NestedTagMismatch - Closing tag doesn't match opening tag

### RenderError
- OutOfMemory - Allocation failed during rendering
- InvalidWidth - Width parameter is zero or negative
- ContentTooLarge - Content exceeds maximum renderable size

### TableError
- ColumnCountMismatch - Row has different column count than header
- InvalidSpan - Cell span exceeds available columns
- OutOfMemory - Allocation failed during table operations

## Implementation Notes
- Use Zig error unions for composability
- Consider adding error context/payload where useful
- Document each error with examples of what causes it
- Update existing code to use these semantic errors instead of generic ones

Add StaticStringMap for colors
description:
Replace runtime string matching with comptime-generated O(1) lookups for named colors.

## Problem
Current color name parsing likely uses linear search through color names, which is O(n) per lookup.

## Solution
Use std.StaticStringMap to generate a perfect hash map at comptime for O(1) lookups.

## Benefits
- O(1) lookups instead of O(n)
- Generated at compile time, no runtime cost
- Standard library pattern, well-tested
- Reduces code complexity

## Implementation Notes
- Audit color.zig for current implementation
- Include all CSS/X11 named colors we support
- Consider case-insensitive matching (lowercase keys, normalize input)
- Add tests verifying all color names resolve correctly
